 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲוִילָה‎</span> **proper name, of a territory** (√ dubious [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>Pa 12 suggests</sup> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוֺל‎</span> ***sand-land, downs***, as Hebrew popular etymology, [[BDB#MV|MV]]<sup>11 give it as actual etymology</sup>; [[BDB#Sta|Sta]]<sup>ThLZ Apr. 28, 1894, 235</sup> compares this, as well as <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוֺל‎</span> ***sand***, with Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***soft mud***, [***dampsand***]) — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶרֶץ הַחֲוִילָה‎</span> [[Gen.2.11|Gen 2:11]] (surrounded or bordered — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סבב‎</span> — by river Pishon; noted for excellent gold, bdellium and ***shoham-stone***); elsewhere without article <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲוִילָה‎</span> [[Gen.10.7|Gen 10:7]] = [[1Chr.1.9|1Chr 1:9]] as a 'son' of Cush (between <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְבָא‎</span> and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סַבְתָּה‎</span>); but also as a 'son' of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יָקְטָן‎</span>, a descendant of Shem [[Gen.10.29|Gen 10:29]] = [[1Chr.1.23|1Chr 1:23]] (between <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אוֺפִיר‎</span> and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יוֺבָב‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַדשֿׁוּר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵח‎</span> [[Gen.25.18|Gen 25:18]] said of limits of Ishmaelitish territory; compare same limits of Amalek [[1Sam.15.7|1Sam 15:7]] (but dubious; [[BDB#We|We]] reads <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טֵילָם‎</span>, compare v[[1Sam.15.4|1Sam 15:4]] and see [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]; Glaser<sup>Skizze ii, 326</sup> reads <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲכִילָה‎</span> as [[1Sam.23.19|1Sam 23:19]]; [[1Sam.26.1|1Sam 26:1]]; [[1Sam.26.3|1Sam 26:3]]). — Most have supposed several regions named <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ח‎</span> to be indicated in these passages: — e.g. [[BDB#Thes|Thes]].

>[!info] Note
> 1. Arabian shore of Persian Gulf [[Gen.10.29|Gen 10:29]] etc. 2. Ethiopian coast [[Gen.10.7|Gen 10:7]] etc. 3. India [[Gen.2.11|Gen 2:11]] (regarded as indefinite extension of 1). [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>[[Gen.10.7|Gen 10:7]] distinguishes 1 and 2 either as quite distinct</sup>, or as different settlements of one great people, and (on [[Gen.2.14|Gen 2:14]]) thinks that <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כל ארץ ח‎</span> [[Gen.2.11|Gen 2:11]] implies vague extension eastward. [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>Pa 12 ff.</sup> 57 ff. identification <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ח‎</span> in all passages with northeast part of Syrian desert, so [[BDB#Mey|EMey]]<sup>Geschichte. Alterth. i. 224</sup>; Glaser<sup>Skizze ii. 323 ff.</sup> with central and northeast Arabia. The question is still undecided.
